title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the country
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Northern Province, the Department of Meteorology says.

title: New Chief Justice to take oath today
byline: Supreme Court judge Justice Murdu Fernando is set to take the oath as Sri Lanka’s new Chief Justice today (02) before President Anura Dissanayake.

title: Announcement on LG Elections postponed until after A/L Exam
byline: It is reported that the announcement regarding the upcoming Local Government (LG) Elections will be issued after the conclusion of the 2024 G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination.

title: Sajith urges Japan to resume halted development projects in SL
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa has urged Japanese Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Akio Isomata, to resume development projects that were halted midway.

title: Biden says he has pardoned his son, Hunter
byline: U.S. President Joe Biden said on Sunday he had pardoned his son, Hunter Biden, who had been convicted of making false statements on a gun background check and illegally possessing a firearm and pled guilty to federal tax charges.

title: Govt. to provide immediate relief to fishermen affected by adverse weather
byline: Deputy Minister of Fisheries Rathna Gamage says that measures will be taken to provide immediate relief to fishermen severely affected by the recent adverse weather conditions.

title: Central Bank of Sri Lanka explains impact of deflation
byline: The Assistant Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), Dr. Chandranath Amarasekara says that they do not expect the deflation to continue for a long time to have an impact on country’s production.

title: Train operations on up-country line resume
byline: Railway operations between the Hali Ela and Uduwara stations on the Up-Country Line have resumed after being disrupted for several days.

title: Dozens killed in crush at Guinea football match - reports
byline: Dozens of people have died in a crush following clashes at a football match in Guinea’s second-largest city, N’zérékoré, local media report.

title: Sri Lanka’s air quality gradually improves - CEA
byline: The Central Environmental Authority (CEA) says that the Sri Lanka Air Quality Index (SLAQI) is gradually reaching towards moderate levels across several regions in the country.

title: Court informed of govt’s stance on Grade 5 Scholarship Exam issue
byline: The Attorney General (AG) has informed the Supreme Court this morning (02) that the Cabinet of Ministers has recommended to award free marks to all students for the 03 questions which were alleged to have been leaked in the 2024 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination.

title: Murdu Fernando sworn in as new Chief Justice
byline: Supreme Court Judge, Justice Murdu Fernando took oath as Sri Lanka’s new Chief Justice this morning (02) before President Anura Dissanayake.

title: Lohan Ratwatte and wife further remanded
byline: Former Minister Lohan Ratwatte and his wife have been further remanded until December 6, by the Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court today (02).

title: Road blocked due to protest opposite Education Ministry
byline: The Kottawa - Borella Road (174 bus route) has been completely blocked for traffic in front of the Ministry of Education due to a protest by Development Officers, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Two monks and hotel owner arrested for stealing ancient Buddha statue
byline: Police have arrested two Buddhist monks and a hotel owner in connection with the theft of an ancient metal Buddha statue with a dragon canopy, valued at over Rs. 20 million.

title: Sri Lankan fishing boats seized with ‘Ice’ in Indian waters escorted to Colombo Port
byline: Two Sri Lankan fishing vessels that were recently apprehended in Indian waters while transporting a large consignment of crystal methamphetamine, commonly known as ‘Ice’, along with the suspects on board, were escorted ashore to the Colombo Port today (02).

title: Tense situation near Education Ministry
byline: A tense situation has been reported in front of the Ministry of Education at Isurupaya, Battaramulla as the police attempted to disperse protesting Development Officers.

title: Suspect arrested for promoting LTTE ‘Mahaviru’ celebrations granted bail
byline: The Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court has granted bail to Kelum Harshana, who was arrested for allegedly promoting the LTTE ‘Mahaviru’ celebrations.

title: Losing your mind looking at memes? The dictionary has a word for that
byline: Are you spending hours scrolling mindlessly on Instagram reels and TikTok? If so, you might be suffering from brain rot, which has become the Oxford word of the year.

title: Three cops injured as development officers’ protest turns violent
byline: Three police officers have been injured and hospitalised following the tense situation during a protest in front of the Ministry of Education at Isurupaya, Battaramulla this afternoon (02).

title: 2024 General Election: Deadline to submit candidates’ expense reports
byline: The Election Commission says that candidates who contested in the 2024 General Election, along with the secretaries of the parties they represented and the leaders of the independent groups, are required to submit their expense reports by December 06, 2024.
